alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN CAMDEN... SOUTHEASTERN PASQUOTANK...SOUTHEASTERN PERQUIMANS AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRITUCK COUNTIES... At 455 PM EDT, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Camden to near Weeksville. Movement was east at 20 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph are possible with these storms. These storms will be near... Camden around 500 PM EDT. Weeksville and Whitehall Shores around 505 PM EDT. Shiloh around 515 PM EDT. Indiantown around 520 PM EDT. Old Trap around 525 PM EDT. Grandy around 550 PM EDT. Sanderling, Corolla and Point Harbor around 600 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Belcross, Poplar Branch, Symonds Creek, Spot, Aydlett, Listers Corner, Glen Cove, Harbinger and Jarvisburg. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may cause localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
